sanskrit_verse:
वाग्दुष्टात्तस्कराच्चैव दण्डेनैव च हिंसतः ।
साहसस्य नरः कर्ता विज्ञेयः पापकृत्तमः ॥ ८.३४५॥
transliteration:
vāgduṣṭāt taskarāc caiva daṇḍenaiva ca hiṁsataḥ |
sāhasasya naraḥ kartā vijñeyaḥ pāpakṛttamaḥ || 8.345 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who commits violence through speech, theft, or physical harm, driven by arrogance, is to be known as the most sinful among wrongdoers.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with conscious integrity, not coercive dominance.
Causation is traced through intent, capacity, and distortion of dharma-vāk.
Capacity-based responsibility requires assessment of awareness and free will in distortion.
Restoration logic demands reintegration of distorted consciousness into dharmic alignment.
Consciousness alignment supersedes punitive frameworks by invoking svadharma realization.
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor causes harm via speech OR theft OR bodily injury AND motive is rooted in arrogance THEN classify as sāhasa offense.
IF classified as sāhasa THEN initiate consciousness-restoration protocol BEFORE social reintegration.
IF harm involves distortion of dharma-vāk THEN mandate pramāṇa-based truth-realignment process.
IF perpetrator demonstrates unawareness THEN assign capacity-development module prior to resolution.
IF completion of restoration is verified THEN declare karmic closure and societal reacceptance.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the threshold for sāhasa classification lies in demonstrable intent rooted in arrogance. The court must prioritize consciousness-assessment over punitive sentencing, ensuring that judicial authority aligns with dharmic restoration rather than retributive justice.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that arrogance manifests sequentially through distorted speech, action, and violence. Responsibility is proportional to awareness; thus, correction follows causal sequence without infliction of suffering. Non-punitive reality rule upholds that only consciousness-realization dissolves adharmic patterns.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Vak Yoga Completion Process to restore purity of expression.
Enforce Dana-Dharma Rebalance Protocol to correct theft-related distortions.
Apply Ahimsa Integration Module to realign physical conduct with non-violence.
Undertake Ahamkara Dissolution Practice under guidance of realized mentor.
Verify Antaḥkaraṇa Śuddhi (inner purification) before societal re-entry.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the ultimate adjudicator.
